org.vertx.groovy.core.streams
[Groovy] Interface ReadStream

org.vertx.groovy.core.streams.ReadStream
  org.vertx.groovy.core.streams.ExceptionSupport
All Superinterfaces:
ExceptionSupport
@groovy.transform.CompileStatic
interface ReadStream
extends ExceptionSupport

Represents a stream of data that can be read from.

Any class that implements this interface can be used by a Pump to pump data from it to a WriteStream.

Authors:
Tim Fox

Method Summary
java.lang.Object dataHandler(groovy.lang.Closure handler)

Set a data handler.

java.lang.Object endHandler(groovy.lang.Closure endHandler)

Set an end handler.

java.lang.Object pause()

Pause the ReadStream.

java.lang.Object resume()

Resume reading.

 
Methods inherited from interface ExceptionSupport
exceptionHandler
 

Method Detail

dataHandler

java.lang.Object dataHandler(groovy.lang.Closure handler)
Set a data handler. As data is read, the handler will be called with the data.

endHandler

java.lang.Object endHandler(groovy.lang.Closure endHandler)
Set an end handler. Once the stream has ended, and there is no more data to be read, this handler will be called.

pause

java.lang.Object pause()
Pause the ReadStream. While the stream is paused, no data will be sent to the dataHandler

resume

java.lang.Object resume()
Resume reading. If the ReadStream has been paused, reading will recommence on it.
